# Biography

John is a General Surgery resident and Thoracic Surgery research fellow at the Cleveland Clinic, as well as a student at Case Western Reserve University, where he's completing a Master of Science in Clinical Research through the Clinical Research Scholars Program.

Some of his interests pertain to esophageal surgery, video-based surgical education, and lung transplantation. His current research, under the mentorship of Siva Raja, MD, aims to better understand long-term clinical outcomes following myotomy for esophageal achalasia, with a particular focus of the role of esophageal morphology on outcomes.

Please feel free to [contact him](mailto:mail.jobarron9@gmail.com.com) by email.
